name: Overview
description: Provide a high-level overview of the project including its purpose, main features, and target audience. Explain what problem it solves and why it exists.

name: System Architecture
description: Describe the overall system architecture including components, their relationships, and data flow. Include diagrams where helpful and explain key architectural decisions.

name: Technology Stack
description: List and describe all technologies, frameworks, libraries, and tools used in the project. Explain why each was chosen and its role in the system.

name: Data Models
description: Document the data models, database schema, and entity relationships. Include field descriptions, constraints, and relationships between entities.

name: Core Components
description: Detail the main components/modules of the system, their responsibilities, and how they interact with each other.

name: Security Considerations
description: Document security measures, authentication mechanisms, authorization rules, and any security-related configurations or best practices.

name: Performance Considerations
description: Discuss performance optimizations, caching strategies, scalability considerations, and any performance-related configurations.

name: Authentication
description: Document the authentication methods supported by the API, including how to obtain tokens, authentication headers, and security requirements.

name: API Endpoints
description: List all API endpoints with their HTTP methods, paths, parameters, request bodies, and response formats. Include example requests and responses.

name: Request/Response Formats
description: Document the standard request and response formats, including headers, content types, pagination, and error response structures.

name: Error Handling
description: Document error codes, error response formats, and how to handle different types of errors returned by the API.

name: Rate Limiting
description: Document rate limiting policies, headers, and how to handle rate limit errors. Include best practices for API usage.

name: Installation
description: Provide step-by-step installation instructions including prerequisites, dependencies, and platform-specific considerations.

name: Getting Started
description: A quick start guide to help users get up and running quickly. Include the minimal steps needed to use the software.

name: Features
description: Document all major features of the software, how to access them, and what they do. Include screenshots or examples where helpful.

name: Configuration
description: Document all configuration options, environment variables, and settings. Explain what each option does and its default values.

name: Troubleshooting
description: Document common issues, error messages, and their solutions. Include debugging tips and where to find logs.

name: Features Overview
description: A brief overview of the main features and capabilities of the project. Keep it concise and highlight key functionality.

name: Usage Examples
description: Provide practical examples of how to use the software including code snippets, commands, and expected outputs.

name: Contributing
description: Guidelines for contributing to the project including code style, pull request process, and how to report issues.

name: License
description: Information about the project's license and any usage restrictions or requirements.

name: Development Setup
description: Instructions for setting up a development environment including IDE configuration, debugging setup, and development tools.

name: Code Structure
description: Explain the project's directory structure, file organization, and naming conventions. Help developers navigate the codebase.

name: Coding Standards
description: Document coding standards, style guides, and best practices to follow when contributing to the project.

name: Testing
description: Document how to run tests, write new tests, and the testing strategy. Include information about test coverage and CI/CD.

name: Deployment
description: Document deployment procedures, environments, and any deployment-specific configurations or considerations.

name: Dependencies
description: List and describe project dependencies, their versions, and any special considerations for dependency management.

name: Environment Variables
description: Document all environment variables used by the application, their purposes, and example values.

name: Database Setup
description: Instructions for setting up and configuring the database, including migrations and seed data.

name: Changelog
description: Document version history, changes, new features, bug fixes, and breaking changes between versions.

name: User Stories
description: Document user stories in the format 'As a [type of user], I want [goal] so that [benefit]'. Include acceptance criteria for each story.

name: Functional Requirements
description: List all functional requirements that define what the system should do. Include requirement IDs, descriptions, priorities, and status.

name: Non-Functional Requirements
description: Document non-functional requirements including performance, scalability, security, reliability, and usability requirements.

name: Use Cases
description: Document use cases with actors, preconditions, main flow, alternative flows, and postconditions. Include use case diagrams where helpful.

name: Acceptance Criteria
description: Define acceptance criteria for features and requirements. Specify conditions that must be met for the requirement to be considered complete.

name: Scope and Boundaries
description: Define what is in scope and out of scope for the project. Clarify boundaries and limitations of the system.

name: Design Principles
description: Document the design principles, patterns, and guidelines followed in the system design. Explain architectural decisions and trade-offs.

name: Component Design
description: Detailed design of individual components including interfaces, class diagrams, sequence diagrams, and component interactions.

name: Integration Points
description: Document integration points with external systems, APIs, and services. Include data formats, protocols, and error handling.

name: Test Strategy
description: Document the overall testing strategy including types of testing (unit, integration, E2E), test coverage goals, and testing tools.

name: Test Cases
description: Detailed test cases with test IDs, descriptions, preconditions, test steps, expected results, and actual results.

name: Test Environment
description: Document test environment setup including hardware, software, data requirements, and configuration needed for testing.

name: Quality Metrics
description: Define quality metrics and KPIs including code coverage targets, defect density, test pass rates, and acceptance thresholds.

name: Bug Tracking Process
description: Document the bug tracking process including severity levels, bug lifecycle, triage process, and resolution workflows.

name: Quality Gates
description: Define quality gates and checkpoints that must be passed before proceeding to the next phase or release.

name: Infrastructure Requirements
description: Document infrastructure requirements including servers, cloud resources, networking, storage, and capacity planning.

name: Deployment Procedures
description: Step-by-step deployment procedures including pre-deployment checks, deployment steps, verification, and post-deployment tasks.

name: Rollback Plan
description: Document rollback procedures including triggers for rollback, rollback steps, data recovery, and communication plan.

name: Network Architecture
description: Document network architecture including VPCs, subnets, security groups, load balancers, and network topology diagrams.

name: Operational Procedures
description: Document standard operational procedures for routine tasks including maintenance windows, backup procedures, and health checks.

name: Incident Response
description: Document incident response procedures including severity classification, escalation paths, communication templates, and post-mortem process.

name: Monitoring and Alerts
description: Document monitoring setup including metrics to track, alert thresholds, dashboards, and on-call procedures.

name: New Features
description: List and describe new features added in the release with usage instructions and any configuration requirements.

name: Breaking Changes
description: Document any breaking changes, deprecations, and migration guides for users upgrading from previous versions.

name: Business Objectives
description: Document the business objectives, goals, and key results (OKRs) that the project aims to achieve. Include success metrics and KPIs.

name: Stakeholder Analysis
description: Identify and analyze all stakeholders including their interests, influence, communication needs, and engagement strategy.

name: Business Process Flow
description: Document current and proposed business processes, workflows, and how the system will support or improve them.

name: Cost-Benefit Analysis
description: Analyze costs, benefits, ROI projections, and financial justification for the project.

name: Risk Assessment
description: Identify potential risks, their probability and impact, mitigation strategies, and contingency plans.

name: Project Vision
description: Define the project vision, mission statement, and long-term goals. Explain the problem being solved and the value proposition.

name: Target Users
description: Define target user personas, their needs, pain points, and how the product addresses them.

name: Success Metrics
description: Define measurable success criteria, KPIs, and metrics to track product performance and user satisfaction.

name: Feature Prioritization
description: Prioritize features using frameworks like MoSCoW, RICE, or value vs effort matrix. Explain prioritization rationale.

name: High-Level Components
description: Document the major system components, their responsibilities, and high-level interactions without implementation details.

name: System Context
description: Define the system boundary, external interfaces, and how the system fits within the larger ecosystem.

name: Module Specifications
description: Detailed specifications for each module including class diagrams, method signatures, and implementation logic.

name: Algorithm Design
description: Document algorithms, pseudocode, flowcharts, and computational logic for complex operations.

name: Error Handling Design
description: Document error handling strategies, exception hierarchies, and recovery mechanisms at the module level.

name: Database Schema
description: Detailed database schema including tables, columns, data types, constraints, indexes, and relationships.

name: Query Optimization
description: Document query patterns, optimization strategies, indexing approach, and performance considerations.

name: Data Migration
description: Document data migration strategies, scripts, rollback procedures, and data validation approaches.

name: UI Specifications
description: Document UI specifications including wireframes, mockups, component library, and interaction patterns.

name: User Flows
description: Document user journeys, navigation flows, and task completion paths through the interface.

name: Accessibility Guidelines
description: Document accessibility requirements, WCAG compliance, and inclusive design considerations.

name: Interface Contracts
description: Document interface contracts between systems including data formats, protocols, and SLAs.

name: Message Formats
description: Document message schemas, event formats, and data exchange specifications for integrations.

name: Traceability Matrix
description: Map test cases to requirements to ensure complete coverage. Track requirement-to-test relationships.

name: Test Coverage Analysis
description: Document test coverage metrics, gaps, and recommendations for improving coverage.

name: Test Summary
description: Executive summary of testing activities, results, defects found, and overall quality assessment.

name: Defect Analysis
description: Analyze defects by category, severity, root cause, and provide trends and recommendations.

name: UAT Scenarios
description: Document user acceptance test scenarios based on business processes and user workflows.

name: UAT Sign-off Criteria
description: Define criteria for UAT sign-off including acceptance thresholds and stakeholder approvals.

name: Release Schedule
description: Document release timeline, milestones, dependencies, and go/no-go criteria.

name: Release Checklist
description: Comprehensive checklist of tasks, approvals, and validations required before release.

name: Communication Plan
description: Document communication strategy for release including stakeholder notifications and user announcements.

name: Change Request Process
description: Document the change request workflow, approval process, and impact assessment procedures.

name: Change Impact Analysis
description: Document how to assess change impact on system, users, and dependent systems.

name: Pipeline Architecture
description: Document CI/CD pipeline architecture, stages, jobs, and automation strategy.

name: Pipeline Configuration
description: Document pipeline configuration, environment variables, secrets management, and triggers.

name: SLA Definitions
description: Define service level agreements including availability targets, response times, and support tiers.

name: SLA Monitoring
description: Document SLA monitoring approach, reporting, and breach handling procedures.

name: Support Procedures
description: Document support request handling, escalation paths, and resolution workflows.

name: Common Issues
description: Document common issues, their symptoms, root causes, and resolution steps.

name: FAQ
description: Frequently asked questions with clear, concise answers for users and support staff.

name: How-To Guides
description: Step-by-step guides for common tasks and procedures.
